author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon the Golan's rocky heights, in space that doth divide,
Israeli troops do take their posts, the buffer zone to bide.
Fear of rebels lurking near, the border they protect,
In the vineyard of defense, thus, new vines they infect.

In the East, where Ukraine lies, 'gainst Russian might they fight,
Their skies grow dark, by drones obscured, in fall's unsteady light.
From Moscow's cask, a bitter brew, of missiles fourfold sent,
Like an ale too strong, its potent sting, a sobering lament.

South Korea's reign, as wine left out, hath turned a sour note,
A sidelined leader sits in shade, while others steer the boat.
Not Yoon Suk Yeol, but prime minister, shall hold the vessel's sail,
'Tis a brew of dark uncertainty, that fills the public grail.

feedItems.title: Israeli Troops Occupy Syria Buffer Zone in Defensive Step
feedItems.description: The move in the Golan Heights comes as Israel fears rebel groups could encroach on its border.

feedItems.title: Inside Ukraine's Battle for the Skies as Russian Bombardments Hit Records
feedItems.description: Moscow fired four times as many drones and missiles this fall as it did the previous year, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis.

feedItems.title: A Sidelined Sitting President: South Korea's Leader Won't Run the Country
feedItems.description: The ruling party and prime minister will handle state affairs, not Yoon Suk Yeol, after he briefly imposed martial law. The opposition calls the arrangement illegal.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the land of Syria, an epoch meet its end,
The seat of Assad trembles, ‘gainst rebels it can't fend.
An eleven-day blitz echoes, as the sky split asunder,
An era cloaked in shadow, torn by sound and thunder.

Bashar, once a healer of sight, clad in tyranny's mail,
A phantom modernizer, an ill-fabricated tale.
His reign acquired through torment, a despot desperate, lone,
In the heart of Syria, his throne transformed to stone.

But lo, the mighty topples, and joy rings across the land,
Amongst the folk, songs soar high, a liberated band.
Yet frets of formless governance doth chill the joyous cheer,
A vacuum vast invades the void, bred by fall and fear.

feedItems.title: The 11-Day Blitz by Syrian Rebels That Ended 50 Years of Assad Rule
feedItems.description: Bashar al-Assad called for help from Russia, Iran and his own military in his last hours as Syria’s leader, learning he had run out of allies and loyalty.

feedItems.title: Bashar al-Assad, an Ophthalmologist Who Became a Dictator, Is the Last of a Despotic Dynasty
feedItems.description: Once a self-styled modernizer, Syria’s president bought time with a harsh crackdown, but his government eventually succumbed to its many enemies.

feedItems.title: Assad's Rule Collapses in Syria, Raising Concerns of a Vacuum
feedItems.description: The events set off celebrations among the population but also sparked concerns about how the disintegration of the regime would reverberate in the region.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the land of Syria, fierce and wild,
Rebels siezed Damascus, the city beguiled.
Assad was deposed, the conflict took flight,
Into a new era, shrouded in night.

The downfall of Assad, a shift in the East,
Turkey boasts gains while Russia's in least.
But the spoils of war can be but a mirage,
Ever shifting sands in a challenging montage.

As Russia and China the war rules amend,
NATO's game plan, they endeavour to defend.
Cyber security, their vigilant stride,
To protect hallowed infrastructure, they stand unified.

feedItems.title: What to Know About the Civil War in Syria
feedItems.description: Rebel fighters seized Damascus and deposed President Assad, taking a more than decade-old conflict into a new phase.

feedItems.title: Assad's Downfall Marks a New Realignment in the Middle East
feedItems.description: Winners and losers have already emerged, Turkey gained, Russia and Iran lost sway—but the gains and losses could prove illusory.

feedItems.title: As Russia and China Rewrite Rules of War, NATO Adapts Its Game Plan
feedItems.description: Cyber and energy security are priorities for the alliance’s new leader, as member nations share more intelligence to protect critical infrastructure.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Damascus' heart the goat now roams,
Bashar, the hare, his burrow unknown;
Retreat and titter, dog in dread,
The Syrian soil bears a dread.

Moscow, the snail, its horn withdrawn,
On Syria's shell, a chilling dawn;
For power's dance, a flitting wraith,
Threatens the 'Saigon moment' bait.

Notre Dame, the phoenix, takes flight,
In world benighted, her spire ignites;
Her hallowed halls, revived from pyre,
In turmoil's gale, a beacon's fire.

feedItems.title: Syrian Government Teeters as Rebels Reach Damascus
feedItems.description: The regime’s security forces and allies were apparently in retreat as President Bashar al-Assad’s whereabouts couldn’t be determined.

feedItems.title: Retreat of Syrian Forces Threatens 'Saigon Moment' for Russia
feedItems.description: Moscow’s support for the Assad regime has helped it project power throughout the region.

feedItems.title: Notre Dame Cathedral Is Reborn in a Darkened World
feedItems.description: The Gothic masterpiece reopened to a world buffeted by war and economic uncertainty, five years after a fire nearly destroyed it.
